summary: Starting college at UMass Boston as IT major; foundations and problem solving.
highlights: Established study workflow; first exposure to structured problem solving.

artifacts.title: Display Connector Catalog (VGA, DVI, HDMI, DP, Thunderbolt) — Group Project
artifacts.desc: Quick reference comparing purpose, ports, and trivia for common display connectors; collaborative class assignment.

artifacts.title: Devices Inventory — Group Project
artifacts.desc: Spreadsheet comparing our devices by specs and purpose.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — Project 8 (Tasks 1–6)
artifacts.desc: Configured end devices, deployed & cabled a small LAN, validated paths with PDUs, and documented physical/logical views.

artifacts.title: VirtualBox on Fedora — VM Setup Demo
artifacts.desc: Short screen recording showing I'm being introduced to Linux via Fedore in Virtual Box.

artifacts.title: My First Website — “Wlacien’s Favorite Hobby”
artifacts.desc: My first HTML page for IT 110 (Fall 2022): headings, images, and paragraphs—no frameworks.

summary: Second semester at UMass Boston; Intro to databases and networking.
highlights: Hands-on with ER modeling, mySQL and basic subnetting; Cisco Packet Tracer labs.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — Basic IP Config & Ping Validation
artifacts.desc: Configured PC0 (IP 192.168.100.1/24, GW/DNS 192.168.100.250), verified local pings (.250, .100), and confirmed cross-subnet ping to 192.168.101.1 fails as expected (no routing).

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — HTTP Request Simulation & PDU Layer Analysis
artifacts.desc: Used Simulation mode to browse to 192.168.100.2, inspected the PDU, and identified Ethernet II → IPv4 → TCP → HTTP fields per the lab guide.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — DHCP Client with ipconfig
artifacts.desc: Switched PC0 to DHCP, received 192.168.100.100/24 with GW 192.168.100.250, and reviewed lease details using ipconfig /all per the lab guide.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — ICMP Packet Capture (Internetwork Layer)
artifacts.desc: Used Simulation mode and Capture/Forward to ping 192.168.100.2, then inspected the outbound PDU (Ethernet → IP → ICMP) fields per the lab guide.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — ARP Broadcast & Header Fields
artifacts.desc: Pinged 192.168.101.1 in Simulation mode to trigger ARP, then inspected the outbound PDU (Ethernet II + ARP) and reviewed MAC/IP fields.

artifacts.title: Essay — AI in Gaming (ENGL 101)
artifacts.desc: Short essay on how AI enhances visuals, NPC behavior, and dynamic gameplay (Mar 25, 2023).

artifacts.title: Essay — AI in the Criminal Justice System (ENGL 101)
artifacts.desc: First academic essay for ENGL 101 (Feb 21, 2023): surveys benefits (predictive policing, risk assessment) and concerns (bias, transparency, privacy).

artifacts.title: How to Build an Ethernet Patch Cable
artifacts.desc: One-page guide: cut/strip cable, twist pairs, crimp RJ-45, and verify with a cable tester.

artifacts.title: SQL Coursework — KIMTAY Sales DB (DDL/DML + Queries)
artifacts.desc: Built a sample sales database (tables, FKs, views, indexes) and practiced joins, subqueries, GROUP BY/HAVING, and stored procedures with cursors.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — Home Network: DHCP Renew & Connectivity Check
artifacts.desc: Released/renewed DHCP on the laptop, obtained 192.168.0.101, and verified connectivity to 192.168.0.1 via ping.

artifacts.title: Networking a Stand-Alone Windows Machine
artifacts.desc: Checked MAC/IP with ipconfig, enabled folder sharing, direct-cabled to a peer, observed APIPA assignment, and discovered the other host.

artifacts.title: Wi-Fi Router Security Lab (Project 10)
artifacts.desc: Reviewed/adjusted SSID broadcast, 2.4 GHz channel & width (20/40 MHz), WPA/WPA2-PSK modes, AES vs TKIP, passphrase strength, guest isolation, and LAN client filtering—plus pros/cons and recommendations.

summary: Transferred to Florida International University (FIU): Staring to B.S. in Cybersecurity.

artifacts.title: Java labs Pack (Fall 2023)
artifacts.desc: All intro level Java labs in one bundle.

artifacts.title: Informative Speech — Security Threats
artifacts.desc: Explains hacking and common attack vectors: eavesdropping, social engineering, phishing, shoulder surfing, and dumpster diving.

artifacts.title: Persuasive Speech — Cybersecurity Awareness (SPC 2608)
artifacts.desc: Case: 2016 phishing (John Podesta) → argue for a 'human firewall' culture: Train • Analyze • Win, plus device hardening, safe browsing, and handling confidential info.

summary: Second semester at FIU, I'm getting more used to college life
highlights: Started using Linux more oftenly, publishing on GitHub

artifacts.title: Essay — AI’s Role in Cybersecurity (ENC 1102)
artifacts.desc: Explores AI for detections/anomaly spotting, phishing and APT detection, plus emerging offensive-AI risks; includes sources and reflection.

artifacts.title: C Program — Functions, Loops, and Basic Arithmetic
artifacts.desc: Practice program showcasing small arithmetic routines, for/while loop variants, and a simple info function, all orchestrated in main.

artifacts.title: C Program — Math, Random, and String Parsing
artifacts.desc: Demonstrates math.h routines (round/ceil/floor/min/max/trig/exp/log/sqrt), rand() usage, and string parsing (vowel/consonant, case transforms, ASCII) with a simple pyramid formatter.

artifacts.title: C Program — 2D Arrays, Swapping/Sorting, ASCII & Loops
artifacts.desc: Builds a 10×10 table and computes row/column totals; sorts three numbers ascending; prints ASCII letters down from 'Z'; safe division loop with sentinel; modulo filter and parallel string arrays.

summary: Diving deeper into cybersecurity: Learning about OS, advanced Java and discrete math.
highlights: Dean’s List; deeper systems knowledge and problem solving. Using Kali Linux everyday in VirtualBox

artifacts.title: Java OOP — Library Mini-Project (Book + Tester)
artifacts.desc: Modeled a Book with availability and a static counter; includes borrow/return, late-fee calc, displayInfo, and a small driver + UML sketch.

artifacts.title: Java OOP — Inheritance (Animal → Bird → Canary)
artifacts.desc: Multi-level inheritance with method overrides; driver program and UML sketch included.

artifacts.title: Java OOP — Polymorphism & Abstraction (Vehicle/Car/Airplane)
artifacts.desc: Abstract Vehicle + Flyable interface; Car & Airplane override behavior; demo exercises dynamic dispatch. Includes UML diagram.

term: Spring 2025 — My hardest semester at college
summary: Applied networking, professional tech writing and HCI.
courses: CGS 1920 — Intro to the Field of Computing
highlights: Dean’s List; began publishing more often in GitHub and attending CTFs.

artifacts.title: Network Design — Subnetting, Routing & Firewall Segmentation
artifacts.desc: Designed a multi-site network from 128.60.80.0/23: VLSM plan, /30 serial links, router interfaces, and a router-firewall segment for servers; includes L3 diagram and site topologies.

artifacts.title: Recommendation Report — Premium Membership Program (Noble 33)
artifacts.desc: Full report: research methods, evaluation criteria, findings, and a tiered membership recommendation with pilot plan.

artifacts.title: Business Letter — Client Billing Remediation
artifacts.desc: Apology + remediation letter for a 13% overbilling incident; proposes credits, free documentation optimization, and enhanced project support. Shows clear tone and concrete remedies.

artifacts.title: Internal Memo — Billing Error & Next Steps
artifacts.desc: Explains a 13% over-billing issue, outlines client engagement/operational support/feedback duties, and proposes service-based remediation instead of refunds.

artifacts.title: Proposal — Fixing Leadership Engagement in PantherSec
artifacts.desc: Plan to investigate low leadership participation via interviews, best-practice research, and a scheduled recommendation report (Mar–Apr 2025).

term: Summer 2025 - Preparations started for AWS Security Specialty
summary: Automation, information retrieval, and global policy; started certificate in Cyber Intel & Info Policy.
courses: ISS 3613 — Issues in Global Cybersecurity Policy
COP 4703 — Information Retrieval and Database Systems Management
highlights: Dean’s List 3x in row; drift auto-remediation mini-project.

summary: Capstone, data comms and cyber policy.
courses: CGS 3095 — Technology in the Global Arena
highlights: Capstone I underway; continuing Cyber Intel & Info Policy certificate. Learning about more advanced Networking
